e="preserve">Charles Kenneth Spears (March 12, 1938 – November 6, 2020) was an American television editor, writer, and producer. He was the co-founder with Joe Ruby of television animation production company Ruby-Spears Productions. Spears and Ruby created "Scooby-Doo", "Dynomutt, Dog Wonder", and "Jabberjaw". He was born in California.
Spears died on November 6, 2020 from Lewy body dementia-related problems at the age of 82.
